channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Tesla buys $1.5 billion in bitcoin, sending its price soaring
item.description: “I make jokes about Dogecoin, but they are really meant to be jokes,” Musk said.

item.title: Super Nintendo World apparently took scenery from a Mario fangame
item.description: Telltale cactus mirrors original sprite from Newer Super Mario Bros. Wii mod.

item.title: Apple/Hyundai car talks ended fruitlessly, report says
item.description: Rumors of an Apple Car are still just rumors.

item.title: The connected battlespace, part two: The fault in our (joint) stars
item.description: Joint All-Domain Command � Control (“JADC2”) is the new hotness—but will it really work?

item.title: “90 bugs left”: Rare devs talk about the nearly completed Goldeneye 007 remake [Updated]
item.description: Members of the 360 remake’s dev team tell all—including the reason it was canceled.

item.title: Marvel drops action-packed 2-minute Falcon and the Winter Soldier trailer
item.description: Anthony Mackie, Sebastian Stan reprise their titular roles in new Phase Four series.

item.title: ABL Space tapped to launch the first orbital rocket from Britain
item.description: “The ABL system is relatively easy, quick, and cost-effective to deploy."

item.title: As cars get heavier, even small speed differences matter in a crash
item.description: A study on speed and crashes has me pining for lightweight cars.

item.title: A curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics, pt. 5: Catching a wave
item.description: When it comes to quantum mechanics, confinement is not necessarily bad.

item.title: YouTube’s lo-fi music streams are all about the euphoria of less
item.description: Lo-fi hip-hop channels have created a community for minimalist escape.

item.title: Review: The Dig brings a famous archaeological find to vivid life
item.description: This tale of the famed Sutton Hoo excavations is based on the novel by John Preston.

item.title: Scientific community on report of a strange chemical at Venus: Probably not
item.description: Researchers behind the initial claim also revise it but say it’s still valid.

item.title: A new lens technology is primed to jumpstart phone cameras
item.description: Smartphone optics have been pretty much the same for more than a decade.

item.title: Gaming sites are still letting streamers profit from hate
item.description: Far-right, racist figures monetize livestreams via “donation management services.”

item.title: Tweaking COVID vaccines to fight variants won’t require big trials, FDA says
item.description: The regulatory agency is drawing on its experience with annually tweaked flu shots.

item.title: Klobuchar targets Big Tech with biggest antitrust overhaul in 45 years
item.description: Big Tech got big through acquisitions—and this bill aims to prevent that in the future.

item.title: Mac utility Homebrew finally gets native Apple Silicon and M1 support
item.description: There aren’t bottles for every package yet, but the work is in progress.

item.title: Chrome users have faced 3 security concerns over the past 24 hours
item.description: A 0-day, malicious extension, and sync abuse are keeping Google developers busy.

item.title: SpaceX plans Starlink phone service, emergency backup, and low-income access
item.description: SpaceX’s latest petition to the FCC details some of its Starlink plans.

item.title: Super High-Fidelity Mario: The quest to find original gaming audio samples
item.description: Investigation of original, uncompressed samples leads to CD-quality restorations.

item.title: Cops can’t access $60M in seized bitcoin—fraudster won’t give password
item.description: The fraudster served two years for distributing bitcoin mining malware.

item.title: Looking for a tiny but powerful PC? Check out the Minisforum U820/U850
item.description: Minisforum packs in more flexibility and expandability than most tiny PCs do.

item.title: Not just Facebook: Snap, Unity warn Apple’s tracking change threatens business
item.description: Snap shares fell even as company assured investors it will weather the change.

item.title: The Arctic Ocean may have gone fresh in ice age times
item.description: Chemical clues in seafloor sediment show an absence of salt.

item.title: Report: Google considering an iOS-style anti-tracking feature for Android
item.description: Android could get tracking controls after “seeking input” from ad companies.

item.title: Apple’s car project could put it on a collision course with Tesla
item.description: Why I don’t expect Apple to focus on driverless taxis or delivery services.

item.title: FDA now reviewing a third COVID vaccine, this one made by Johnson & Johnson
item.description: The review process is expected to take several weeks.

item.title: DDoSers are abusing the Plex Media Server to make attacks more potent
item.description: Plex Media servers using SSDP let DDoSers amplify attacks by a factor of 5.

item.title: Rocket Report: SpaceX sets new reuse record, Astra valued at $2.1 billion
item.description: “This takes us a step closer to our mission of improving life on Earth from space.”

item.title: Lost Alaskan Indigenous fort rediscovered after 200 years
item.description: The Tlingit built the Sapling Fort in 1804 to repel a Russian naval attack.

item.title: Signs that SARS-CoV-2 is evolving to avoid immune responses
item.description: Mutations are changing, but not eliminating, the antibody response to the virus.

item.title: Remastered images reveal how far Alan Shepard hit a golf ball on the Moon
item.description: 50 years ago, the Apollo 14 astronaut hit a golf ball that traveled roughly 40 yards.

item.title: Zoombombing countermeasures are ineffective in the vast majority of cases
item.description: Password-protecting meetings is among the most ineffective protections.

item.title: Google Pixel phones will soon track heart rate using only the camera
item.description: No PPG, no problem: Just stick your fingertip on top of the camera lens.

item.title: SpaceX Starlink passes 10,000 users and fights opposition to FCC funding
item.description: Electric co-ops say Starlink is “experimental” and shouldn’t get FCC money.

item.title: New report on Apple’s VR headset: 8K in each eye, potential $3,000 price tag
item.description: Plus, our analysis: How legit is this idea, anyway?

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: LG OLED TVs, Amazon Kindle Paperwhite, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on recommended laptops and noise-canceling headphones.

item.title: Parler CEO says board fired him for planning to ban “neo-Nazi” groups
item.description: Matze claims he wanted platform back online, but other leadership refused compromise.

item.title: Amazon will use cameras and AI to monitor delivery drivers
item.description: Footage of potentially dangerous situations will be uploaded to the cloud.

item.title: Ancient embalmers used mud to hold a damaged mummy together
item.description: After grave robbers damaged the remains, embalmers undertook emergency repairs.

item.title: White House says its supports Artemis Program to return to the Moon [Updated]
item.description: “We urge you to proceed with the planned selection.”

item.title: A silicon chip shortage is causing automakers to idle their factories
item.description: Automakers canceled orders due to COVID-19, and foundries switched to other customers.

item.title: Ford Mustang Mach-E review: The people’s pony goes electric
item.description: Not quite as much fun—or efficient—as a Tesla Model 3.

item.title: Rare 50 million-year-old fossilized bug flashes its penis for posterity
item.description: It dates back 50 million years, so this group may be twice as old as previously assumed.

item.title: SolarWinds patches vulnerabilities that could allow full system control
item.description: Fixes come as SolarWinds sorts out its role in a major hack on its customers.

item.title: Russia’s Sputnik V vaccine looks good in early analysis
item.description: If the results hold up—a big if—we’ll have another good vaccine option.

item.title: Pornhub brings in third-party “identity verification” system for users
item.description: Ideally, the arrangement would both confirm consent and keep performer data private.

item.title: Amazon begins delivering packages with prototype electric trucks
item.description: Amazon is aiming to put 100,000 Rivian electric trucks on the road by 2024.

item.title: AT&T customer since 1960 buys WSJ print ad to complain of slow speeds
item.description: Open letter to CEO asks why AT�T left DSL areas with shoddy Internet access.

item.title: Malicious Chrome and Edge add-ons had a novel way to hide on 3 million devices
item.description: 28 malicious extensions disguised traffic as Google Analytics data.

item.title: GSK eyes next-gen COVID vaccine as it inks deal to help boost current supply
item.description: GSK, Sanofi, Novartis step up to help boost global COVID-vaccine supply.

item.title: Modded Game Boy looks like an Apple product, works as Apple TV Remote
item.description: Yeah, it works as an Apple TV remote—but it’s also beautiful to behold.

item.title: Boston Dynamics’ robot dog gets an arm attachment, self-charging capabilities
item.description: The world’s most advanced commercial robot can now open doors and turn valves.
